docs.snippet: Banking merger fever has spread south of the equator, with the pairing of two Brazilian financial powerhouses: Banco Itaú and Unibanco. Analysts valued the deal at 38.1 billion reals ($17.7 billion), and it creates the largest private financial...
docs.lead_paragraph: Banking merger fever has spread south of the equator, with the pairing of two Brazilian financial powerhouses: Banco Itaú and Unibanco. Analysts valued the deal at 38.1 billion reals ($17.7 billion), and it creates the largest private financial conglomerate in South America.
docs.abstract: Banking merger fever has spread south of the equator, with the pairing of two Brazilian financial powerhouses: Banco Itaú and Unibanco. Analysts valued the deal at 38.1 billion reals ($17.7 billion), and it creates the largest private financial conglomerate in South America. The deal had been planned for a while, the companies said, a contrast [...]

headline.main: Analysts See Benefits From Big Bank Deal in Brazil

docs.snippet: Jamaica's Golden Age     Many hot spots around the globe had just a brief time in the sun -- a moment when they were the ''it'' destination for celebrities and the wealthy of their era. For Jamaica, that golden age was the 1950s and the early '60s.

docs.snippet: With dozens of World Cup qualifiers and international friendlies, here are three individual performances to watch today.
docs.lead_paragraph: It's international day in the soccer world. There iswas a full slate of World Cup qualifiers for Concacaf and Asian Football Confederation teams. Some arewere meaningful, like Saudi Arabia vs. South Korea (South Korea 2, Saudi Arabia 0), and others less so, like U.S.A.-Guatemala (coming up at 8 p.m. Eastern). Meanwhile, European, South American and African teams will keep kept busy with dozens of friendlies, including old rivalries like England-Germany (England 2, Germany 1) and new ones like Israel-Ivory Coast (2-2 draw).
docs.abstract: With dozens of World Cup qualifiers and international friendlies, here are three individual performances to watch today.

docs.snippet: The one high point of France's lackluster 0-0 draw with Uruguay was the debut of striker Steve Savidan.
docs.lead_paragraph: How would France have played Wednesday if Coach Raymond Domenech hadn't received a vote of confidence last month from the French Football Federation? Les Bleus turned in a "stuttering" performance against Uruguay in an uninspired friendly that ended 0-0.
docs.abstract: The one high point of France's lackluster 0-0 draw with Uruguay was the debut of striker Steve Savidan.
